plants.name: Chrysanthemum indicum
plants.description: Chrysanthemums are popular garden flowers known for their variety of vibrant colors and are symbols of autumn in many cultures. They bloom profusely in cooler autumn weather.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, especially East Asia, Europe, and North America
plants.funFact: Chrysanthemums have been cultivated in China for over 2,500 years and are often associated with longevity and rejuvenation.

plants.name: Nerium oleander
plants.description: Oleander is an evergreen shrub thriving in warm climates that produces clusters of fragrant flowers. Although most varieties bloom from spring to fall, some can continue blooming into late autumn in mild climates.
plants.bloomingSeason: May to October (sometimes into November in mild climates)
plants.location: Mediterranean regions, southern United States, and subtropical zones
plants.funFact: All parts of the Oleander plant are highly toxic if ingested, yet it remains a popular ornamental plant in warm regions due to its hardiness and showy flowers.

plants.name: Salvia greggii
plants.description: Autumn sage is a drought-tolerant perennial shrub native to Texas and northern Mexico, known for attracting hummingbirds with its tubular, brightly colored flowers that bloom from late summer into fall.
plants.location: Southwestern United States and northern Mexico
plants.funFact: Autumn sage's long blooming season makes it an excellent nectar source for pollinators late in the year.

plants.name: Cyclamen hederifolium
plants.description: This species of cyclamen is a hardy, tuberous plant that flowers in autumn, with nodding pink or white flowers appearing before the leaves fully develop.
plants.funFact: The ivy-shaped leaves of Cyclamen hederifolium have beautiful marbled patterns, making the foliage as attractive as the flowers.
